 The Investment Production Analyst builds a deep understanding of Fidelity mutual fund products to provide research, reporting, and the timely delivery of product collateral.  Fidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission
 *to strengthen the financial well\\-being of our clients.* 
 We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non\\-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients' money.

 At Fidelity, you'll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples' lives, including yours. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees' Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a top 10 Best Place to Work in 2024\\. description:
Site: Mass General Brigham Incorporated
 
  





 At Mass General Brigham, we know it takes a surprising range of talented professionals to advance our mission\\-from doctors, nurses, business people and tech experts, to dedicated researchers and systems analysts. As a not\\-for\\-profit organization, Mass General Brigham is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community. We place great value on being a diverse, equitable and inclusive organization as we aim to reflect the diversity of the patients we serve.
 







 At Mass General Brigham, we believe a diverse set of backgrounds and lived experiences makes us stronger by challenging our assumptions with new perspectives that can drive revolutionary discoveries in medical innovations in research and patient care. Therefore, we invite and welcome applicants from traditionally underrepresented groups in healthcare \\- people of color, people with disabilities, LGBTQ community, and/or gender expansive, first and second\\-generation immigrants, veterans, and people from different socioeconomic backgrounds \\- to apply.
 



  





  





**Job Summary** 



 Currently, the Diversified Businesses (DB) portfolio companies (and MGB more broadly) have underdeveloped commercialization capabilities. An experienced entrepreneurial, commercial operations executive with significant strategic sales and marketing, product management, and operations experience would would work launch and grow new diversified businesses that have been identified and evaluated by MGB Strategy and BD team. This individual would also serve as the interim General Manager until such time as full\\-time resources are in place to lead the new business. It is expected that some of the new businesses will continue to report directly to this individual even after a GM is in place. Lastly, this individual will work with the existing DB portfolio companies to help strengthen and professionalize their commercial capabilities.
 
  












**Qualifications** 











 Mass General Brigham (MGB) is an integrated academic health care system, uniting great minds to solve the hardest problems in medicine for their communities and the world. MGB connects a full continuum of care across a system of academic medical centers, community and specialty hospitals, a health insurance plan, physician networks, community health centers, home care, and long\\-term care services. A nonprofit organization that is committed to patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community, MGB is one of the nation's leading biomedical research organizations and a principal teaching affiliate of Harvard Medical School.
 







 As Mass General Brigham pursues its strategy to become the integrated academic healthcare system of the future, with patients at its center, it established a Diversified Business Division in 2023 to further support its mission of care delivery, research, education, and community health. The Diversified Business Division is an operating segment within Mass General Brigham, alongside the enterprise's current care delivery, research and innovation, and health insurance parts. Reporting to the Mass General Brigham Chief Financial Officer and Chief Strategy \\& Transformation Officer, the Mass General Brigham President, Diversified Businesses is responsible for developing, growing, and overseeing the performance of the portfolio of MGB's Diversified Business Division. Currently, the DB Group is comprised of three businesses representing over $1B in revenue.
 







**Responsibilities:** 



* Lead the launch and growth new diversified businesses that have been identified and evaluated by MGB Strategy and BD team and serve as the interim\\-General Manager, where needed, until a full\\-time General Manager is recruited for new businesses;
* Oversee growth and management of select new businesses where the GM will report to the VP Commercial Operations;
* Work with MGB Strategy and Business Development (SBD), Finance, and President, Diversified Businesses on the evaluation, business planning, and launch of new businesses;
* Work with MGB SBD, Finance, and President, DB on Joint Venture Partner and acquisition candidate selection, due diligence, deal execution and integration;
* Work with existing DB portfolio companies to strengthen and support commercial capabilities including but not limited to: conduct customer segmentation and needs assessment; identify product market fit and our unique value proposition; productize existing and new offerings; develop messaging and help develop sales and marketing materials; develop best practices for lead generation, proposal development, and closing revenue generating deals; build stronger customer account management capabilities;
* Participate in quarterly business reviews and annual planning process representing a commercial perspective;
* Serve as a member of the Diversified Businesses leadership team, helping guide the strategy and operations of Diversified Businesses







 Qualifications
 


* Broad healthcare knowledge and experience (5\\+ years working in healthcare, including multiple years of working for or with providers);
* Entrepreneur/intrapreneur who has built multiple early\\-stage businesses, including developing business strategy, finding product\\-market fit, making first sales, refining business models, recruiting and managing entrepreneurial talent, and delivering product / service offerings while simultaneously building business infrastructure;
* 10\\+ years experience in leadership and management roles, ideally both in small and larger orgs
* MBA or equivalent preferred by not required



  












**Additional Job Details (if applicable)** 











  












**Remote Type** 










 Onsite
 
  












**Work Location** 










 399 Revolution Drive
 
  












**Scheduled Weekly Hours** 










 40
 
  












**Employee Type** 










 Regular
 
  












**Work Shift** 










 Day (United States of America)
 
  












**EEO Statement:** 










 Mass General Brigham Incorporated is an Equal Opportunity Employer. By embracing diverse skills, perspectives and ideas, we choose to lead. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, sex, age, gender identity, disability, sexual orientation, military service, genetic information, and/or other status protected under law. We will ensure that all individuals with a disability are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.
 
  




**Mass General Brigham Competency Framework** 



 At Mass General Brigham, our competency framework defines what effective leadership "looks like" by specifying which behaviors are most critical for successful performance at each job level. The framework is comprised of ten competencies (half People\\-Focused, half Performance\\-Focused) and are defined by observable and measurable skills and behaviors that contribute to workplace effectiveness and career success. These competencies are used to evaluate performance, make hiring decisions, identify development needs, mobilize employees across our system, and establish a strong talent pipeline.

title: Senior Product Manager, Search & Discovery
description:
America’s Test Kitchen (ATK) is seeking a
 **Senior Product Manager, Search \\& Discovery** 
 , to oversee the strategy and execution of optimizing how ATK customers find and engage with content across its digital platforms. This role will enhance search functionality, build engaging discovery experiences, and integrate SEO strategies to connect customers with recipes, equipment reviews, techniques, shows, and guides that meet their needs.
 



 As a Senior Product Manager, you will collaborate with cross\\-functional teams, including editorial, engineering, design, data, and marketing, to deliver a cohesive, personalized experience that drives customer satisfaction, retention, and membership growth.
 



**Responsibilities** 



* **Define and deliver a compelling search \\& discovery roadmap** 
 in collaboration with stakeholders based on customer needs and aligned with ATK’s business objectives, prioritizing initiatives based on user research, analytics, and business impact.
* **Enhance ATK’s search capabilities** 
 by refining the implementation of ATK’s third\\-party search engine to deliver relevant, intuitive search results. You’ll work to implement and optimize sorting and filtering mechanisms, leverage personalization features and behavioral data, and continuously improve content tagging, taxonomy, and metadata to enhance search accuracy.
* **Drive innovation in content discovery** 
 by reimagining ATK’s homepage and browsing experiences to inspire and guide customers to relevant content. You’ll help deliver personalized recommendations leveraging member preferences and engagement data. In addition, your job will be to empower the editorial team to curate seasonal and topical content with scalable tools.
* **Lead cross\\-functional collaboration** 
 by partnering with editorial, engineering, design, and SEO teams to improve user journeys across platforms and with marketing to deliver integrated campaigns that enhance content discoverability. You’ll also work with data teams to monitor performance metrics and inform data\\-driven improvements.
* **Support SEO** 
 in collaboration with SEO leadership and Editorial, implementing content\\-based strategies supported by optimized structured data and metadata that drive organic traffic and improve the visibility of ATK content in search engines.



**Skills \\& Qualifications** 




 Required
 


* 5\\+ years of product management experience, with at least 2 years focused on search, discovery, or personalization.
* Demonstrated success in managing search platforms (e.g., Algolia, ElasticSearch) and delivering customer\\-centric solutions.
* Exceptional collaboration and communication skills with technical and non\\-technical stakeholders.
* Strong analytical skills with experience leveraging user research and performance metrics to inform decisions.
* Proficiency in data analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Mixpanel) and A/B testing.
* Familiarity with SEO principles and integrating them into product strategies.



 Preferred
 


* Experience in subscription\\-based or content\\-driven digital products.
* Familiarity with metadata, taxonomy, and content tagging strategies.
* Passion for cooking and food media.



 This position is located in our Boston, MA, office in the Seaport district. It is the expectation that the person in this role will work a hybrid schedule of 3 days per week (Tuesday, Wednesday \\& Thursday) in the office and 2 days per week remotely.
 



**America’s Test Kitchen’s Digital Product Management Team** 
  

 Our team is responsible for digital product development at America’s Test Kitchen. We want to understand our customers inside and out and help them use our digital platform to be better cooks. We value working collaboratively, asking for help when we need it, saying yes to trying new things, helping each other succeed, and putting our members first in everything we do. Success requires trust and risk\\-taking, so we practice and seek radical candor from our teammates (\\+ have a lot of fun together and eat well!).
 



**About America’s Test Kitchen** 




 The mission of America’s Test Kitchen (ATK) is to empower and inspire confidence, community, and creativity in the kitchen. Founded in 1992, the company is the leading multimedia cooking resource serving millions of fans with TV shows (America’s Test Kitchen, Cook's Country, and America’s Test Kitchen: The Next Generation), magazines (Cook’s Illustrated and Cook’s Country), cookbooks, a podcast (Proof), FAST channels, short\\-form video series, and the ATK Essential Membership for digital content. Based in a state\\-of\\-the\\-art 15,000\\-square\\-foot test kitchen in Boston’s Seaport District, ATK has earned the trust of home cooks and culinary experts alike thanks to its one\\-of\\-a\\-kind processes and best\\-in\\-class techniques. Fifty full\\-time (admittedly very meticulous) test cooks, editors, and product testers spend their days tweaking every variable to find the very best recipes, equipment, ingredients, and techniques. Learn more at https://www.americastestkitchen.com/.
 



**Why America’s Test Kitchen:** 




 We're passionate about cooking, and about creating the best place to work. We're small enough for your ideas to make a big impact, and large enough to offer you opportunities to grow professionally at any stage of your career. We want you to take risks and make mistakes — that's how innovation happens in our test kitchen, in our offices, and in life.
 



 We at America’s Test Kitchen believe food media can be a powerful force for social change. We are passionate about building an inclusive workforce that represents many different cultures, backgrounds, abilities, identities, and perspectives.
 



 We welcome your application.

 Fidelity Capital Markets (FCM) is seeking a director\\-level associate to join the Equity Trading division. This role will have two primary focus areas, product strategy and product management, and will offer a unique opportunity to work across Fidelity and directly impact the strategic direction of Fidelity's equity trading offerings!
 











**Product Strategy** 
 \\- You will be responsible for creating and driving forward a complete equity trading product strategy for the client segments that have multiple touchpoints across Fidelity: retail investors, registered investment advisors, broker\\-dealers, and corporations. This strategy should both support Fidelity's growth and improve the customer experience! While you will rely on stakeholders across the division, and often across the broader Fidelity, to create and implement this strategy, you will ultimately be responsible for bringing it to life. To be successful, you will need to:
 


* Define the current offering of products and services provided to these client segments
* Conduct market, customer, and competitive research and define a desired state for the offering that is supported by robust and data\\-driven hypotheses
* Create a strategic plan for getting to the desired state
* Create a process that allows Fidelity to continuously monitor progress of the strategic plan, pivot when new information arises, and prioritize new opportunities







**Product Management** 
 \\- You will also be the Squad Lead (Product Manager) for one of the technology squads that supports the FCM Equity Trading division. This squad is responsible for FCM Equity Trading's proprietary real\\-time surveillance system, which surveils the division's trading systems in real\\-time with the goal of detecting and alerting on potential issues or risks as soon as possible; it is a critical risk management tool for the division. To be a successful Squad Lead, you will:
 


* Partner with internal stakeholders to define an innovative multi\\-year product strategy and roadmap, with clear objectives and metrics
* Define business requirements and prioritize the product backlog
* Lead the squad through all Agile events (e.g. Daily Stand\\-Ups, Backlog Refinement, Sprint Planning, Retrospectives, Demos, Quarterly Planning, etc.)

* Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills with an ability to translate and present complex topics to wide audiences
* Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to build relationships and interact/influence/negotiate effectively at all levels of management and peers
* Strong organizational, time management, and prioritization skills with the ability to manage multiple sophisticated projects simultaneously
* Self\\-starter who embraces pace over perfection and enjoys working in a fast\\-paced environment
* Great teammate with a positive attitude and the desire to constantly work across the firm














**The Team** 

 Fidelity Capital Markets is the trading arm of Fidelity Investments. The FCM Equity Trading division provides equity and options trading products and services to a wide array of Fidelity's clients. The team's mission is to use the strength of its common core platform \\& capabilities to deliver the best execution experience in the industry at scale and enable Fidelity and its partners to grow and acquire the next generation of customers. This role is on the Product and Trading Solutions team within FCM Equity Trading which is responsible for strategy, program management, and product management across the division.

 Placement in the range will vary based on job responsibilities and scope, geographic location, candidate's relevant experience, and other factors.
 







 Base salary is only part of the total compensation package. Depending on the position and eligibility requirements, the offer package may also include bonus or other variable compensation.
